job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Decent pay Make your own hours Amazing supervisior

review_title: Opportunity For A Lot Of Work

cons: - Leadership is very top heavy - Pay is very low (especially with the extra overtime needed) - At times, I was asked to create solutions to problems, and after a lot of effort went into building solutions, there was an issue with support to implement or hold people accountable

job_title: Project Coordinator in Dallas-Fort Worth

review_title: Don’t Know Value of Certified PMPs

job_title: Research Assistant in Fort Worth, TX

job_title: Senior Administrative Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Overall this is a great place to work. Decent salary, they are flexible and mostly caring. They are making a difference.
cons: Often people aren't held accountable for their responsibilities and others have to pick up the slack. I believe you will find this in every organization to a certain extent. Most of the cons are worth it.

job_title: Police Officer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great students and staff to work with
cons: Human resources unsure need more resources

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The department I was in was amazing and caring. They actually cared for you and got you whatever you needed to function within their department. Day and night from unt Denton and hsc. If I would go back I absolutely would in a heart beat.
cons: Dept chair is pretty nosy and cheesy but he's an all around great guy. Just expected your 110% everyday everytime.

review_title: The premier values based institute to work for!
job_title: Technology Commercialization in Coppell, TX
pros: The University of North Texas Science Center at Fort Worth (HSC) is a values-based health institution and has four core values that drive its success - Serve Others First, Integrity, Respect, Collaboration, and Be Visionary. These values serve as the basis for the way the university employees and students are expected to conduct themselves on a daily basis. The cornerstone of the HSC is Trust.
cons: The downside of working at a state system institution is that sometimes there are unnecessary bureaucracy that is imposed upon its institutions. For example the UNT System has a single General Counsel Office that services all of the member institutes.

job_title: Home Health Aide in Dallas, TX
pros: Nothing is bad and disappointing
cons: Everything is satisfying and good

review_title: Don't expect to climb the ladder without sacrificing your mental health permanently
job_title: Research Specialist in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
Benefits are decent
Some PIs on campus have your best interests at heart
cons:
Non-student employees routinely get pushed far beyond what's normally acceptable
PIs value their research above your own health

job_title: Digital Communications Specialist in Fort Worth, TX

review_title: Okay place to work, but its going downhill
job_title: Executive Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: Immediate co-workers, opportunity to work hybrid, nice campus.
cons: The pay, lack of raises, hard to get help from other departments, they seem to care more about faculty and students rather than staff, co-workers in other departments aren't always helpful or friendly, many are non-responsive. They keep saying they've made process improvements but much of the software we use is terrible and the new processes put more work and more responsibility on the admins.

job_title: Research Assistant in Fort Worth, TX

job_title: Research Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: People who work here care about what they do

review_title: An ok place, but could be better!

review_title: It's a career, not a job
job_title: Program Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: salary, benefits, work environment, co-workers, mission
cons: abrupt re-organizational changes, top-heavy leadership model

job_title: Research Associate in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The people are great at UNTHSC.
cons: It would be nice if the compensation was more in line with industry.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
Work life balance is great
Time off is great - PTO increases with the amount of time  you work for the State and Sick Leave is practically infinite.
State holidays off
Two weeks off for Christmas and New Years
Beautiful Campus
Friendly staff
My department had a lot of opportunity for training and personal growth - everyone was able to go to at least one conference last year (I went to 2 VERY informative ones).
cons:
In the past there has been a lot office politics. Much of that is being driven out with the administration, but there are still some vestiges of it left in some departments.

I worked in Tech, and this is a government job and as such it does not pay as much as the same position in the private sector. I was allowed to take contract jobs, and the work-life balance was great. The trade off was worth it for me.

review_title: It all depends on your boss
job_title: Project Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
Sick days, vacation days which increase over time the more years in the more days off,  retirement, insurance

Other pros really depend on your individual boss they can make or break your day-to-day job.  Since the whole university isn't doing only 1 thing it's not easy to compare one experience to another.  So just be sure to interview your future supervisor in your interview because that will determine whether it will be pleasurable or not.  Also some jobs have growth potential others do not.
cons: UNTHSC is a large state institution so as with higher ed and state jobs there are politics and red tape including an occasional stereotypical state employee attitude of barely doing your job.  Most people are great but every company has some bad apples, they are just harder to get rid of at state institutions.  If you can see past that and not let it bug you, you're fine.

job_title: Associate Professor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Most people who work here are wonderfully kind, bright, and always willing to go above and beyond. This includes HR, IT, and Finance. It's Texas, and the hospitality is genuine. It's one of the most collegially supportive environments I've ever worked in.
cons: Upper management has cleaned house and with good reason, many folks at the leadership level needed to go as it created a stagnant environment with regard to innovation. Not all, but many. However, the new 'value' campaign does not convey what was intended. We always had values and it connotes that we didn't before the new administration… sound familiar? There are good people there, they just need to be allowed to innovate without being told what to do.

review_title: Taking care of employees is not a priority...
job_title: Clinical Service Representative in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
-Great entry level experience
-Looks great on the resume 
-Great healthcare benefits
-The people you work directly with are kind (feels like a family)
cons:
-Very low salaries 
-Rarely any raises (if even any) & no bonuses 
-Many unnecessary meetings (waste of time since nothing ever changes)
-Employers do not listen to the employees’ needs
- Very short staffed; you do the work of 2-3 people since they are too cheap to hire other employees 
- Things of low importance becomes a priority (ex: spending money on a new building or re-doing their logo instead of giving employees a raise) 
-Employees are overall unhappy and want to find something better (this seems to serve more as a temporary job for most)

job_title: Mail Clerk in Saginaw, TX
pros: We have excellent benefits and good communication here. I have been working in the mailroom for over 10 years. Job stability is good. our team works very good together and we get the job done in a reasonable amount of time.
cons: Our compensation could be better. raises are very rare in the university. we have over 1400 faculty and staff and there is always lack of communication outside the mail room department.

job_title: IT UNT Systems in Denton, TX
pros: Benefits - but with no raises and below market salaries, they hardly mean as much. Location, beats commuting to Dallas or Fort Worth.
cons: They do not care about you at all. Do not walk the talk about values. There is very high turnover in management. In IT, you have to be in the "buddy club" to have any opportunities for advancement. Management brings in friends from the outside to fill supervisory positions that do not have the skills/experience for the role, and are therefore gone within a year.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The salary and start-up packages are generous and competitive with top schools.
cons: I became aware of  incidents that seem to me could be categorized as sexual harassment and gender discrimination, especially in the School of Public Health (SPH)   Also, it seemed to me that faculty  felt pressured by the administration to pass students who had failed exams.  In my opinion, our entire department's  tenured/tenure-track full-time faculty (none of whom were terminated as far as I know) left  the SPH due to these and other issues.

job_title: Senior Auditor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Working for a State University provides the satisfaction of contributing to future generations.   Additionally, auditors are tasked with testing internal controls to ensure that Universities are good stewards of taxpayer and student dollars.  Typically, state jobs provide job stability, good benefits, and a pension.
cons: Jobs in the Audit Department at UNT are high risk.  Internal Auditor independence and objectivity  is not always supported by audit management.   Type A personalities may find the uncertainty and inconsistency of this job to be highly stressful.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Flexible Schedule, Great Work Life Balance, Not micromanaged, New President making positive changes
cons: Lack of leadership. No clear direction in your role. New Employee Onboarding is very unorganized and it all depends on the manager and department. Compensation plan/metrics is still being figured out. There are a lot of people that have been doing the same thing for 20 years and are not open to change

review_title: Health Science Center is a great place to work!
job_title: Interior Designer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: This institution is supportive of its staff and provides opportunities for personal growth. The location is exciting and the research conducted by the faculty makes us all very proud.
cons: Work can be very hectic, as many departments have projects at the same time that require attention from the facilities department.

review_title: Deteriorating environment for now, but may turn around.
job_title: Physician in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Not many - retirement benefits?
cons: Low salary, high volume, excessive micromanagement, arbitrary decisions

job_title: Case Manager in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The schedule was helpful for a person with children
cons: The structure of the program was unorganized and the supervisor did not have a degree which made it hard to progress with serving clients! Mileage payments were not paid on time I once waited 3 months to be paid for my mileage

job_title: Internship in Fort Worth, TX
pros: You could work at your own pace as well as pick your own topic. There was a number of researchers to work under, and gaining that experience was great and enriching.
cons: There was not as much order where some cases needed more guidance and supervision.

job_title: Research Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great place to work. The location is central and accessible to major sites in the city. Friendly student setting.
cons: Administrative processes are sometimes slow. Sometimes you may have to wait for log to execute simple inter-departmental procedures and processes.

job_title: Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great work environment with good work/life balance.  Employees truly care about one another and students.
cons: Compensation was lacking and promotions were rare and far between for amount of work expected.  Currently in the process of adapting a new value system which will dictate all future hires, promotions and disciplinary action.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Can be a relatively pleasant workplace, dependent on department and supervisor. There were periods where it was very good and others where it was not.
cons: Seems to constantly be reorganizing which can be good or bad. Raises were often non-existent despite exemplary reviews.

job_title: Student Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: It is one the best way to support some of your expenses while studying, also it gives a chance to get your foot in the door and start your career.
cons: It makes studying little difficult as you end up spending some valuable time in your job, which could have been used for assignments.

job_title: Senior Administrative Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Ability to have a great work/life balance. You have the ability to set up your 40 hours a week to your needs with department approval. They have multiple options that will fit for you. Universities done give flexibility like this, so to me; it’s very appreciated.
cons: There are none at this time.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: This company allowed me to work while I went to attended school. The people in the company were always very supportive and encouraging. I was always given good direction and follow-up from my superiors.
cons: The job is stressful and variable, so it is difficult to plan PTO ahead of time.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: UNTHSC has a very impressive culture of appreciating staff and students through the Valubility program. This makes people to put in their best at work.
cons: The rate at which people quit is high.

job_title: Program/Project Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great benefits: excellent matching program for retirement, excellent health care coverage with dental, excellent paid time off during holidays (about 10 days off at Christmas paid that doesn't require you to use vacation time!)
cons: Raises aren't really that common..if you get one, it's small.

review_title: It was a great opportunity to work in an academic environment.

cons: Staff turnover rates were high in upper management.  Parking was a challenge at times.

job_title: Business Systems Analyst in Fort Worth, TX

job_title: Research Assistant in Arlington, TX
